results.title: Donald and the wheel
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Donald Duck accidently invents the wheel. Later Egyptians, Greek, Romans and others improve on it. Through songs and commentary the possible history of the wheel is traced. Donald, however, is not very impressed, particularly the aspect of the chaos of modern traffic.
results.description: Donald Duck accidently invents the wheel. Later Egyptians, Greek, Romans and others improve on it. Through songs and commentary the possible history of the wheel is traced. Donald, however, is not very impressed, particularly the aspect of the chaos of modern traffic.

results.title: Donald's fire survival plan. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Donald Duck and his nephews outline the techniques of surviving a fire in the home. Stresses the need for prevention with smoke detectors and collapsible ladders, and presents the lifesaving, “stop, drop and roll” technique.
results.description: Donald Duck and his nephews outline the techniques of surviving a fire in the home. Stresses the need for prevention with smoke detectors and collapsible ladders, and presents the lifesaving, “stop, drop and roll” technique.

results.title: Donald's fire survival plan (K)
results.creator_credit: Les Clark, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The need for a fire survival plan in the home. Every day over 1500 homes burn, and 18 lives are lost, one third of them children. Schools, industrial plants and public buildings practise proper procedures, why not homes? Donald Duck works out a plan to protect his family in case of fire.

results.title: Donald's crime (K)
results.creator_credit: Jack King, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A Donald Duck cartoon made at the peak of the series’ popularity, and an outstanding use of the medium to explore the psychology of guilt. Donald Duck needs money to take his girlfriend, Daisy, to a dance, so he steals his nephews’ piggy bank. Tormented by guilt, Donald returns the money before his nephews discover what has happened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack King, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Donald's better self (K)
results.creator_credit: Jack King, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Donald Duck has two sides to his character. On the one hand, his good self strives to do the right thing, but his bad self usually wins. Donald sleeps late in the morning, and it takes his better self to make him dress and start off for school. On the way to school his bad self entices him to play truant.

results.title: Donald
results.brief_description: Released to celebrate 50 years in show business, this video presents a selection of Donald’s finest moments. Individual titles include: “Donald’s cousin Gus”, “The Riveter”, “The Autograph hound”, “A Good time for a dime”, “Donald’s tire trouble”, “Drip dippy Donald” and “The New neighbour”. The compilation is introduced by rare film footage of Walt Disney. No other production details available.

results.title: Don Quixote: Kitri's wedding
results.brief_description: The American Ballet Theatre’s production of Don Quixote: Kitri’s Wedding at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. Stars Mikhail Baryshnikov and Cynthia Harvey with choreography by Baryshnikov.

results.title: Don Quixote in the tales of La Mancha
results.brief_description: Two adventures featuring Don Quixote: DON QUIXOTE AND THE FAMILY TREASURES: Don Quixote falls in love with Fidora, thinking she’s his dream princess Dulsonia, but Fidora is not motivated by love, she’s after the Quixote family fortune. Meanwhile with help from Sancho, Don Quixote protects Fidora from the infamous Black night: DON QUIXOTE MEETS THE WITCH QUEEN: Don’s Quixote’s ploy of stealing the witch queen’s magic diamond to give to his dream princess backfires when the diamond is broken and witch queen Marlena wants Don Quixote to marry her. No other production details available.
